title: 111_hr530
content: The Act titled "Santa Ana River Water Supply Enhancement Act of 2009" includes a section on the Prado Basin Natural Treatment System Project, amending the Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act to add this project. The Act "Santa Ana River Water Supply Enhancement Act of 2009" includes a section on the Prado Basin Natural Treatment System Project, authorizing $20,000,000 for planning, design, and construction of natural treatment systems and wetlands for the Santa Ana River flows. The Federal share of the project cost shall not exceed 25%, and funds provided by the Secretary cannot be used for operation and maintenance. This section will expire 10 years after enactment. The table of sections in Public Law 102-575 is amended by inserting a new section after the last item. SEC. 16__. REGIONAL BRINE LINES: The Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act is amended to include provisions for regional brine lines. The Secretary may assist in constructing regional brine lines in Southern California to export salinity from the Colorado River to the Pacific Ocean. The Federal share of the project cost shall not exceed 25 percent. The Secretary may enter agreements and regulations as needed. The Secretary may provide funds for constructing regional brine lines in Southern California, with the Federal share not exceeding 25 percent or $40,000,000. Funds cannot be used for project operation or maintenance. This section expires 10 years after enactment. SEC. 16__. LOWER CHINO DAIRY AREA DESALINATION DEMONSTRATION AND RECLAMATION PROJECT under the Reclamation Wastewater and Groundwater Study and Facilities Act allows for the construction of regional brine lines in Southern California with a Federal share not exceeding 25 percent or $40,000,000. This section expires 10 years after enactment. The Secretary, in cooperation with various agencies, will participate in the Lower Chino Dairy Area desalination project with a Federal share not exceeding 25% of the total cost or $50,000,000. Funds provided by the Secretary cannot be used for project operation or maintenance. Appropriations are authorized as needed, and this section expires after a certain period. The section expires 10 years after enactment. A conforming amendment is made to the table of sections in Public Law 102-575. Lower Chino dairy area desalination demonstration and reclamation project.
